p: The proportion of HIV-positive individuals receiving ART (oral or LA-ART) was assumed to increase from an average of 75% in 2017 [26] to an average of 81% by 2029, with no change in suppression rates over time. Individuals adherent to ART have a 96% reduction in transmission risk [27] and are assumed to have the same mortality rates as those who are HIV uninfected. Individuals who are non-adherent to ART are assumed to not be virally suppressed. Rates of non-adherence vary by age, sex, and CD4 count, with AYA having lower adherence than adults [28]. Of AYA currently on oral ART, on average 75% are estimated to be virally suppressed, compared to roughly 85% of adults aged 25 and older [28].
